page.title: 15 The Manor House
page.content: Next to the church is the Manor House,or{Judith's House},so called because the Manor of Yardley Hastings was given to the Countess Judith by Willam the Conqueror after he passed through the village.It is one of the oldest secular houses in the County of Northamptonshire, and is scheduled as an ancient monument. The original Manor house may have been built by John de Hastings who died in 1325, or his son Laurence.The Manor itself passed through a succession of hands until 1524 when it passed into the Compton family with whom it remains today. Excavations have revealed that the Great Hall was 45ft. by 30ft. and the part still standing is thought to be the service section of the Old Manor House, containing the Buttery and the Pantry,with a large Parlour above.It also boasts a Norman arch and walling.
